item.title: All Hades 2 Chaos Trials, Ranked By Difficulty
item.description:
Highlights

  • Hades 2 introduces Melinoë with new Nocturnal Arms & Chaos Trials, elevating the challenges from the original game.
  • The Chaos Trials offer varied difficulties, strategic weapon combinations, and unique boons from gods like Hera, Hephaestus, and Aphrodite.
  • Players must navigate challenging trials like Precarity, Fury, and Doom using skill, luck, and clever use of Melinoë's abilities.

Supergiant Games has another hit on its hands with the Early Access version of Hades 2 -- a direct sequel to the first Hades. Instead of having Zagreus return, fans play as his sister Melinoë and she gets an entirely new set of Nocturnal Arms to play with and, ostensibly, rescue her family from the clutches of...also her family. Primordial Chaos is back, too, with a new look and the same curiosity from the first game.

The game introduces lots of new mechanics such as resource gathering, crafting, and steamy hot springs scenes. However, perhaps the most interesting addition is the Chaos Trials -- specific challenges Melinoë must overcome to gain rewards from Master Chaos themself. Each one uses a specific weapon, a specific keepsake (or none), and takes place in a particular region. The difficulty rating on each trial doesn't always indicate how hard it actually is for some players. So which challenges are the most difficult Chaos Trials in Hades 2 ?

This article contains spoilers for Hades 2 which is currently in Early Access. All information is subject to change pending the full release of the game.

15 Trial Of Origin

Difficulty Rating: 1/5

  • Location : Erebus
  • Weapon : Descura the Witch's Staff, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : None
  • Boon : Primordial Chaos

Players can unlock these trials when they access the Pitch Black Stone in the same area as Nocturnal Arms . It shows the first Chaos Trial that has Melinoë traversing Erebus with naught but her starting equipment and a boon from Master Chaos. It's a fairly straightforward and short run as it is the very first trial the player can access.

Players progress through the first level as usual and even fight Hecate at the end. She will sometimes comment on the bizarreness of the situation, suggesting awareness of Master Chaos' tampering with the scenario. After beating Hecate, Melinoë returns to her room in The Crossroads with the challenge completed.

14 Trial Of Vengeance

Difficulty Rating: 1/5

  • Location : City of Ephyra
  • Weapon : Revaal the Argent Skull, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : Evil Eye
  • Boon : Hera

This time, Melinoë bears Revaal to take down the Cyclops Polyphemus , along with the Evil Eye keepsake from Nemesis. This provides 20% bonus damage against the last foe who defeated the player. Melinoë can also gain boons from the Queen of Olympus throughout this trial, so she can do decent AoE damage over time.

Players shouldn't have a difficult time with this one as the Argent Skull allows Melinoë to be extremely mobile as a direct counter to the lumbering Cyclops. Be sure to optimize what Hera boons are available throughout the trial, as well making use of any Hermes fonts along the way.

13 Trial Of Labrys

Difficulty Rating: 1/5

  • Location : Erebus
  • Weapon : Zorephet the Moonstone Axe, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : Lion Fang
  • Boon : Hephaestus

This Chaos Trial has Melinoë deal less damage the further she progresses into the trial. Herakles' keepsake the Lion Fang grants Melinoë 30% bonus damage that decays by 5% after each encounter. The Moonstone Axe , while powerful, makes Melinoë slower than other weapons, but it can also deflect projectiles and block.

Players will need to rely on the Hephaestus boons for additional damage and protection. The boss fight against Hecate may prove more of a challenge as well, depending on how comfortable a player is with Zorephet .

12 Trial Of Flame

Difficulty Rating: 2/5

  • Location : Fields of Mourning
  • Weapon : Umbral Flames Ygnium, Aspect of Moros
  • Keepsake : Everlasting Ember
  • Boon : Hestia

Some players aren't fans of Ygnium , but Moros' aspect for it makes attacks stick around for 6 seconds. If Melinoë hits them with her Special in that time, it causes an explosion, which helps to clear out lots of enemies and does burst damage to solo enemies. Pair this with Hestia's damage over time and Melinoë's mobility to easily crush this trial and get some stardust.

11 Trial Of Vigor

Difficulty Rating: 2/5

  • Location : Oceanus
  • Weapon : Descura the Witch's Staff, Aspect of Momus
  • Keepsake : Blackened Fleece
  • Boon : Aphrodite

Medea's keepsake, the Blackened Fleece , pairs exceptionally well with the aspect of Momus. Melinoë will deal 20% bonus damage with her Omega moves after taking 250 points of damage. That's a lot, yes, but the aspect of Momus lets Melinoë absorb the damage from her Omega Special move to restore 5 life while under 50% health.

The only thing in this trial that doesn't have much synergy is certain boons from the Goddess of Love . They require the player to do damage up close -- something Descura isn't exactly good at doing.

10 Trial Of Gold

Difficulty Rating: 2/5

  • Location : City of Ephyra
  • Weapon : Lim & Oros the Sister Blades, Aspect of Pan
  • Keepsake : Gold Purse
  • Boon : None

Gold feels a bit easier to come by in Hades 2 than its predecessor, but Charon's keepsake bankrolls Mel with an additional 100 gold. Romping through Ephyra with Lim and Oros is easy enough, even if it makes the Polyphemus boss fight a bit more threatening.

Leverage Charon's coffers to boost health and Magick and be sure to let the Aspect of Pan do its work. Mel's Special attacks will seek foes standing in her Cast, as well as fire more blades after she channels.

9 Trial Of Salt

Difficulty Rating: 2/5

  • Location : Oceanus
  • Weapon : Lim & Oros the Sister Blades, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : None
  • Boon : Poseidon

Friendly Uncle Poseidon helps Mel on this Chaos Trial as she wields the Sister Blades . This means blast damage, the Slip status effect, knockaway effects, Magick restoration, reward bonuses, and more.

The only problems players might encounter are avoiding damage from AoE enemies like Scylla's front attack, the death explosion from Hippos , spin attacks from Serpents , etc. Play it smart and Mel will emerge victorious.

8 Trial Of The Moon

Difficulty Rating: 2/5

  • Location : Erebus
  • Weapon : Zorephet the Moonstone Axe, Aspect of Charon
  • Keepsake : Moon Beam
  • Boon : None

The Titan Goddess Selene has a special bond with Melinoë, and she grants her a special power most nights -- a power the Moon Beam keepsake further augments. The keepsake provides an additional upgrade for Mel's Hex ability when she finds a Path of Stars . Unfortunately, players have to rely on luck and random generation as to which Hex they might get.

Some are extremely powerful such as Total Eclipse or provide healing like Moon Wate r while others, like Phase Shift , just slow things down for a bit. Depending on player builds, different abilities can be effective, so just go with the flow here and try not to take too many hits from Hecate at the end.

7 Trial Of Precarity

Difficulty Rating: 3/5

  • Location : City of Ephyra
  • Weapon : Revaal the Argent Skull, Aspect of Medea
  • Keepsake : Experimental Hammer
  • Boon : Apollo

Icarus' keepsake grants Mel a different weapon boon every 10 encounters, meaning that players must adjust their playstyle as they progress through the trial. These boons can do everything from prime Magick to grant additional offensive power to provide pomegranate slices and 10 healing every 5 encounters. This pairs decently well with Apollo boons and the unique status effect Daze , which imparts a 20% chance for a foe's attack not to deal damage.

Wielding Revaal also means that Mel has a lower chance of taking damage since she can maintain distance between her and her foes most of the time. Leverage Apollo's Perfect Image boon for an easier trial.

6 Trial Of Fury

Difficulty Rating: 3/5

  • Location : Oceanus
  • Weapon : Descura the Witch's Staff, Aspect of Circe
  • Keepsake : Crystal Figurine
  • Boon : Chaos, Apollo, Aphrodite, Selene

Circe's Crystal Figurine keepsake is one of the best in the game, as it activates a random Arcana card after Mel takes down a Guardian . However, it won't do much for her in the Chaos Trial since it takes place in one location: Oceanus . The Aspect of Circe grants Descura Serenity after Mel lands 21 attacks. This boosts Omega move damage and restores some of Mel's spent Magick.

Descura's Omega moves are fantastic for line damage, so take the time to line those up -- especially in the boss fight against Scylla and the Sirens . Leverage what boons are available and remember to stay mobile.

5 Trial Of Heartache

Difficulty Rating: 3/5

  • Location : Rift of Thessaly
  • Weapon : Umbral Flames Ygnium, Aspect of Eos
  • Keepsake : Beautiful Mirror
  • Boon : Aphrodite

Remember how some Aphrodite boons require that the player get close to enemies? Ygnium doesn't really allow for that -- even with the aspect of Eos that has attacks grow in size and then return to the player as they sprint. The Beautiful Mirror keepsake doesn't do much for players either, as it only lets them rarify an Aphrodite boon once per night.

If players don't want to dedicate the extra brain power and time to making this strategy work, they'll need luck and patience. Avoid taking damage as much as possible, get extra Magick to exploit Omega moves, and pick up health and other boons where available. Be sure to also exploit Mel's mobility as Ygnium's attacks will damage enemies as they return to her.

4 Trial Of Humility

Difficulty Rating: 4/5

  • Location : Erebus
  • Weapon : Descura the Witch's Staff, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : None
  • Boon : Apollo

This challenge might sound daunting at first, but players will find themselves breezing through it once they've mastered Descura's skill set and memorized Hecate's moveset. The 4/5 difficulty is mostly because players don't get a keepsake, and they can't use their Arcana cards.

That puts a decent amount of the run on luck of the draw when it comes to gaining Magick or health from chamber rewards. Still, if players can avoid taking damage and be patient, they'll get through this trial with no problems.

3 Trial Of Blood

Difficulty Rating: 4/5

  • Location : Rift of Thessaly
  • Weapon : Lim & Oros the Sister Blades, Aspect of Artemis
  • Keepsake : White Antler
  • Boon : None

Yes -- this one is called the Trial of Blood because Melinoë will take a fair amount of damage. The Sister Blades don't put out a ton of damage by themselves, and they require Melinoë to get in close to her attackers. However, the Artemis aspect lets her parry occasionally while using her Omega Attack and riposte directly after. This means that she can block an attack and then attack her assailant immediately.

Artemis' keepsake also gives Melinoë a 20% bonus crit-chance if she is at or below 30 health. It's a risky venture -- especially with Eris out there with the Adamant Rail -- but players can rise to the challenge.

2 Trial Of Haste

Difficulty Rating: 4/5

  • Location : Fields of Mourning
  • Weapon : Descura the Witch's Staff, Aspect of Melinoë
  • Keepsake : Metallic Droplet
  • Boon : None

Hermes won't be providing Melinoë with boons in this trial -- just his keepsake. It lets Melinoë move, channel Omega moves, and strike 20% faster for 200 seconds (or about 3 minutes). That means that she basically has no boons or enhancements by the time she gets to Cerberus .

Even with how frustrating the Trial of Heartache is, this one might be more so for some players, and it may take several to a dozen tries before they start seeing success. Take advantage of what boons randomly pop up in the Fields of Mourning and keep calm during the Guardian fight. Melinoë is agile and Descura keeps her mobile. Use it.

1 Trial Of Doom

Difficulty Rating: 5/5

  • Location : Oceanus
  • Weapon : Zorephet the Moonstone Axe, Aspect of Thanatos
  • Keepsake : Engraved Pin
  • Boon : Demeter

In perhaps the most difficult Chaos Trial, Melinoë wields the scythe of the God of Death and Moros' keepsake. This lets Melinoë avoid death for 10 seconds while she keeps fighting; if no foes are left after the time runs out, she regains 30 health instead of perishing and ending the run. This has some anti-synergy with Thanatos' aspect for Zorephet as it grants Melinoë 1% crit chance every time she hits with an Omega move...until she takes damage.

However, players must make the most of Demeter's boons as they can freeze foes and do a decent amount of AoE damage on their own. Combine this with smart blocking, lots of magic for Omega moves, and luck to complete the trial.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for July 20, 2024
item.description:
Strands has yet another letter grid to try to sift through in order to find a selection of themed words. If you enjoy the daily puzzles from the New York Times Games, but you are stuck on this one in particular, you aren't alone. This is a difficult one that calls for some hints.

To win today, you will need to know more than just how to play Strands ; you'll also need to know all about the theme without knowing what it is first, and you'll need to be able to think outside the box. Thankfully, this article is here to help anyone who needs it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #139 for July 20, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue A Seat At the Table . There are eight things to find: one Spangram and seven themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you want some general hints that won't give away any of the words in the puzzle, you can find some below. Each section has just one general clue to help you get closer to the theme for today.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

Would a couple of spoilers help you solve the New York Times Games Strands ? You can find two spoiled words and their locations in the two section below.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you are still stuck on this minimalist puzzle game, the full answer is in the section below. Press the Read More button to see all the themed words and their positions in the letter grid.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get the puzzle? The explanation for this free PC puzzle game is in the section below.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: Hunter Era Nen Tier List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Hunter Era Nen Tier List
  • Best S-Tier Hunter Era Nens, Explained

As the name suggests, Hunter Era is an RPG based on the Hunter X Hunter anime in which each player can learn unique Nen abilities. Each of these abilities offers you different skills suitable for various purposes and are the main weapons in this Roblox experience, so you will be using them quite often.

For this reason, you should choose not only strong Nen abilities but also those that suit your playstyle. But, of course, getting them is not so easy. This tier list ranks all Hunter Era Nen in the game, so you can make the right choice for your character.

Hunter Era Nen Tier List

When starting your adventure in the Hunter Era , like Gon in the original anime, you will not have Nen abilities. To learn it, you will need a teacher, so you must go to Whale Island and find the Nen Master there. Fortunately, learning takes very little time — or rather, just a couple of clicks. In exchange for Spins, players can receive one of the available Nen, which are, of course, divided by rarity. The drop rate of the rarest ones is extremely low.

  • Common - 60%
  • Rare - 29%
  • Epic - 10%
  • Legendary - 1%

But, it is worth noting that the rarest does not necessarily mean the best. Some of the Epic Nen perform as good as Legendary ones. If you're not sure which ability to choose, check out our Hunter Era Tier List where we've ranked all the Nens from best to weakest.

Nen Rarity Tier
Kurapika Epic S Tier
Killua Legendary S Tier
Meruem Legendary S Tier
Gon Legendary A Tier
Hisoka Epic A Tier
Leorio Common B Tier
Uvogin Rare B Tier

Best S-Tier Hunter Era Nens, Explained

As you can see, there aren't many Nen in Hunter Era . However, the abilities that occupy the S Tier offer players skills that are impossible to refuse:

  • Meruem - The best choice for players who prefer to fight in the berserker style. In addition to massive damage and a variety of attacks, this Nen reduces damage taken by 50% for a certain time.
  • Killua - Unlike the previous Nen, this one is more focused on speed, as it provides the fastest attacks in Hunter Era . In addition, it is suitable for close and long-range combat.
  • Kurapika - It is the most balanced of all Nen abilities. With it, you can stun enemies, fight at any distance, and restore your health.

item.title: Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn – How to Get More Healing Flasks
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get More Healing Flasks in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn
  • All Known Hamlets in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn

Just like almost every souls-like out there right now, Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn utilizes Healing Flasks to refill player health. The player has a set number of charges that are refilled every time they rest. Flintlock continues the tradition of increasing the number of Healing Flask charges through a specific mechanic in the game, and once you figure out what that mechanic is, you'll be able to seek it out as you explore. This guide will explain what that mechanic is, and how to find it in the world, revealing how to get more Healing Flasks in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn .

How to Get More Healing Flasks in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn

In Flintlock, players can get more Healing Flasks by clearing out a hostile Hamlet , and then interacting with the Coffee Shop Host once the Hamlet is cleared out and the Leader defeated. This mechanic is introduced fairly early on in Flintlock. The first Hamlet players will be introduced to is Port Solace , which pits Nor against several enemies, culminating in the fight against Iron Crown, the area's Leader. Once the leader is defeated, Nor will automatically be placed in front of the Coffee Shop. Head inside the building, and look for the odd-shaped creature in the center of the main room. Hold Triangle/Y after approaching the entity to interact. After a brief conversation, Nor will receive an upgrade to the Healing Flask, adding one charge. Once the Coffee Shop has been unlocked, it will be added to Flintlock 's fast-travel network.

Each Healing Flask charge refills 50% of your health. To increase your max health, visit Flintlock 's Inaya Shrines .

Locating the Second Healing Flask Upgrade:

Once players complete the first area, which effectively serves as a long tutorial, it will not be long before they can find the second Healing Flask upgrade. After upgrading your gear for the first time with Baz, you will begin " Defenders of the Storm," the first real quest in the game. After learning the portal mechanics, you will come to the first Lodestone in the region. The second upgrade is not far from here. Follow these directions to reach the second hostile Hamlet, Gavel Gate.

  • From the Lodestone, head northwest up the road towards the castle.
  • After passing a small house on the right, turn right and head towards the edge of the cliff. You'll see a portal skull at the edge. Use it to reach the rocky area a bit out from the cliffs. Climb to the top and then look southwest to find more portals, which lead to the back of Gavel Gate.
  • Make your way through Gavel Gate until you reach Galen the Noble. Galen is a shield-and-mace-wielding enemy. He packs a serious punch with his mace, so make sure you enter the fight with as many flask charges as possible.
  • Defeating Galen the Noble will clear the Hamlet, even if there are lesser enemies remaining. Nor will automatically be placed in front of the Coffee house. Speak to the Host inside to upgrade your Healing Flask again.

The Hamlet/Coffee Shop mechanic is the only known way to upgrade Healing Flasks in Flintlock. There are currently seven known Coffee Shops that upgrade the Healing Flask. Compete every Hamlet you encounter to unlock them all, upgrading the Healing Flask to its max level.

All Known Hamlets in Flintlock: The Siege of Dawn

Hamlet Name

Location

Port Solace

  • Opening Region

Gavel Gate

  • Three Peaks
  • The Cord

Mudfish Dock

  • Three Peaks
  • Pilgrim's Bend

White Bridge

  • Three Peaks
  • Clear Revenant fight

First Anchor

  • Wanderer's Rest
  • Just after first camp.

Blackharvest

  • Wanderer's Rest
  • North of Sibyl's Teeth camp.

Wisdom's Edge

  • Wanderer's Rest
  • Just before City of Sibyl

item.title: League Of Legends: 10 Beginners Tips For Swarm Game Mode
item.description:
Six years after the last PvE event, Riot has brought back a special mode of this type for League of Legends . Called Swarm , the gameplay diverges completely from the standard MOBA style and significantly differs from other PvE events previously developed by the company.

Inspired by games like Vampire Survivors , League of Legends ' Swarm mode places players on new maps, facing successive and larger hordes of enemies. This requires players to pay close attention to the map details to dodge enemy projectiles and attacks. For a novice player unfamiliar with the genre, the PvE mode might seem a bit complicated initially, but there are several tips to ease the adventure.

10 Play With Friends

Better With Company

The Swarm experience is designed to be enjoyed by players both solo and accompanied by others. However, the experience becomes more fun when accompanied by friends. Moreover, there are several benefits that can make the game easier.

The number of characters present in each session is higher, so defeating enemies becomes easier. Additionally, players can try different champion compositions for the adventure. Matches also last longer because when an ally dies, another can revive them, something that doesn't happen in solo matches. Lastly, experience and gold are shared among players, so the evolution is faster.

9 Be Patient

The Mode Has A Learning Curve

Players accustomed to defeating their enemies in Summoner’s Rift but who have never experienced anything in the Bullet Hell genre or similar might find the mode a bit strange at first. Its gameplay is different from a typical League of Legends match, so patience is required for Swarm Mode.

This style of play is designed for players to lose the first few times they try the stages to accumulate resources, such as gold, which can be exchanged for permanent buffs to attributes. Additionally, the more attempts made, the more accustomed players will become to enemy patterns and develop better strategies to advance.

8 Use Abilities Without Fear

They Work Differently Than In Summoner’s Rift

In a regular League of Legends match, it is common for players to save some abilities for more critical moments of teamfights. However, in Swarm mode, they work differently. Here, champions only have their E and R abilities, unlocked at levels 3 and 6, respectively.

The ideal approach is to use these abilities, especially the E, whenever possible, particularly when surrounded by enemies. Jinx, for instance, has an impactful ability on the map, allowing her to create space more easily. Briar, on the other hand, also has useful powers, but they require more player experience.

7 Avoid Chokepoints

Such Areas Limit Escape Routes

The main mechanic of League of Legends ' Swarm mode is that players need to master character movement, which is crucial for long-term survival. Therefore, players should identify potential chokepoints where they could be cornered by enemies.

In these regions of each map, particularly in the late game when hordes are massive, champions can easily die by not being able to handle all the enemies. Thus, it's important to opt for staying in open areas where it's possible to plan a repositioning route.

6 Don't Be Afraid To Take Damage

Sometimes It’s Necessary To Reposition

The focus of League of Legends ' Swarm mode is to stay alive for 15 minutes, summoning the boss of each stage. For this, players need to avoid enemies and bullets launched by them, but it is also crucial to understand that eventually, monsters will reach the champions.

At certain moments, especially when hordes are accumulating at a particular point on the map, choosing to jump into the middle of them and take some damage in exchange for better positioning can be important. Playing with friends, sacrifices to revive an ally can also be a useful strategy.

5 Explore The Map

It’s Possible To Find Useful Resources For Swarm

The initial moments of each challenge in League of Legends ' Swarm mode are calm, with few enemies being summoned to challenge players, giving them the freedom to explore the map. Through this practice, it is possible to find useful resources in loot boxes, such as health recovery or gold.

It's also possible to find other items, some indicated on the mini-map and others not. Upgrade cards, offering players a free item without needing to level up the champion, or even Miss Fortune's Spires, providing temporary boosts to some attributes, are crucial throughout the game.

4 Check Equipment Synergy

And Combine Them With Attributes

There are many ways to build each character during League of Legends ' Swarm matches. There is no correct way to build them, as the options are random, and sometimes the expected bonus might not appear for the player.

However, there are some synergies between equipment and attributes that players should look out for to enhance performance in each match. This can be seen by pressing TAB on the left side of the screen, which will indicate which abilities benefit from the attributes that can be acquired during the game.

3 Invest Points In Ability Haste

Important Attribute For Various Skills

There are different passive abilities players can acquire throughout the game, such as increased armor, Health Points, or even the overall size of some abilities. However, Ability Haste is one of the most useful in League of Legends ' Swarm mode.

This attribute is important in several ways, as attacking quickly and having abilities available as soon as possible is crucial for clearing enemy hordes. So, whenever it appears in the shop and there isn't a more interesting upgrade, such as the Master form of a Weapon, consider buying it. Additionally, it's also important to prioritize this attribute in the permanent upgrades shop.

2 Spend Gold Earned In Swarm Matches

Vital for Long-Term Survival In League of Legends

Completing some missions or collecting gold coins on the map will earn players gold not meant to be used during Swarm matches but rather after each one ends. These credits can be exchanged for permanent upgrades, turning League of Legends into a sort of roguelike.

There is no correct recommendation on what to prioritize, as this varies depending on each player's preferred style. So, it’s important to experiment with a bit of each permanent attribute and see which adapts best to the chosen champion's style and brings more long-term benefits. Jinx, for example, benefits from Ability Haste and higher damage.

1 Try A Bit Of Everything

Find What Best Fits Each Play Style

League of Legends ' Swarm mode features nine champions to play, along with a wide combination of items. Initially, only a few options will be available, with others being unlocked as stages are survived, missions are completed, or bosses are defeated. The tip is to experiment and see the benefits of each one.

By experimenting, players can understand which champions and items best adapt to their favorite play style, as well as learn more about each one's mechanics. Sometimes, it might even be enjoyable to play a champion in Swarm mode that was never considered in League of Legends ' Summoner’s Rift , like Yasuo.
